column2: officially the Municipality of Parang (Maguindanaon: Ingud nu Parang; Iranun: Inged a Parang; Tagalog: Bayan ng Parang)
column3: is a 1st class municipality in the province of Maguindanao
column8: through Executive Order No. 82. The town was part of the province of Shariff Kabunsuan from October 2006 until its nullification by the Supreme Court in July 2008.

column1: It is bordered to the north by Barira and Matanog
column3: and on the south is Sultan Kudarat.

column1: Parang is politically subdivided into 25 barangays.
A cultural festival is held every August 18 in commemoration of the founding anniversary of Parang. Events are organized by the municipal government with the participation of various stakeholders
Golf course in Camp S.K Pendatun
Major sea cargo vessels connect Polloc Port to Manila and other Philippine cities.
Tricycles are the main modes of public transport in the municipality. Several shuttle vans and PUJs provide regular trips to Cotabato City and other municipalities.

column2: Inc.) provides electric power to the locality. Inland barangays use solar power as installed by our donor agencies.
